column4: Hey anyone here knows a way to run Ubuntu from within Windows (like as an emulator, my linux is on another partition)
i had a knoppix live cd boot from within windows once, i think with QEMU
it's the only frickin PC I got <_<
yeah i got that too but i finally decided to use i386 because i couldn't get anything working in amd64
reinstall ubutun i386 and forget you have a 64bit processor :)
nvm..... don't feel like losing all I've set up already <_<
yeah that's what i thought... then I spent more time trying to make everything work... i lost even more time there
I've got a lot set up already
but just backup your home dir, you'll keep most crucial prefs and documents
then it's really easy to install everything you need with just a couple of commands with i386 files, cause nothing is missing and everything is compatible
